definition: to sponsor/to adopt (pledge to give sb or sth one's special attention or support)/to adopt (choose to raise a child or animal as one's own)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: While enjoying the beautiful plum blossom, people can also adopt them.
sentences.chinese: 今年市民在赏梅的同时还可以认养梅花。

sentences.english: Citizens may not only enjoy the beautiful plum blossom scenery in the garden, but also adopt them.
sentences.chinese: 今年市民在赏梅的同时还可以认养梅花。

sentences.english: This childless couple adopted a daughter from the orphanage.
sentences.chinese: 这对无子女夫妇从孤儿院认养了一个女儿。

sentences.english: I adopted a tree in the garden of our residential area.
sentences.chinese: 我在我们住宅小区的花园里认养了一棵树。

sentences.english: There are virtually no healthy, newborn children waiting to be adopted.
sentences.chinese: 事实上不会有健康的新生儿等着要被人认养。

sentences.english: The boy's fosterage to America came at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩被认养到美国发生在早先的时期。

sentences.english: This also allowed them to advocate the concept of adopting instead of purchasing pets to the general public.
sentences.chinese: 并向外界宣导以认养代替购买的养宠物观念。

definition: to claim (as one's property)/to adopt (a child)/to accept (an illegitimate child as one's own)
to take in and care for (an elderly person, a dog etc)/to adopt (a child)/adoption
cooperative/workers' or agricultural producers' cooperative etc
